line_1: And, if Folks ask the Reason for't,
line_2: Say, one was long, and t'other short.

line_1: So far, at least, I thank You for't.
line_2: Your Tale, howe'er apply'd, was short:

line_1: I acknowledge, and thank a good appetite for't,
line_2: I can make a good meal upon mutton and port.

line_1: That writing Truth had his Bones broken for't?
line_2: Or how would Iuvenal appear at Court,

line_1: An' what is strange, they praise him for't.
line_2: To souse his sonnets on the court;

line_1: The roads, they say, are n't much the better for't.
line_2: Well! for the turnpike, that will do no hurt,

line_1: Ne'er thinkan they wad fash me for't;
line_2: The poor, wee thing was little hurt;

line_1: Ne'er thinkan they wad fash me for't;
line_2: I straiket it a wee for sport,

line_1: Ne'er thinkan they wad fash me for't;
She whisper'd Rob to leuk for't:
line_2: Fu' cozie in the neuk for't,

line_1: Fu' cozie in the neuk for't,
line_2: She whisper'd Rob to leuk for't:

line_1: Nor pay such a cursed extravagant Sum for't:
line_2: Tho' at Home she might eat a good Dinner in Comfort,
